name: places/ChIJ6wg2C5tZwokRitdxiGbzqjM
formattedAddress: Moynihan Train Hall Food Court, 383 W 31st St Suite 037, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: Moynihan Train Hall Food Court, 383 W 31st St Suite 037, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Counter-serve chain where guests create their own salads or wraps from a large array of ingredients.

originalText.text:
I had lunch twice at this place for take out, and found the salad tasty and delicious. The whole station has whole vibe and ambiance to it, I appreciated the decor and how fast the service was delivered (it was salad nonetheless ðŸ¥—) I found the staff to be attentive, friendly and made sure my order was fulfilled (though I had to remind them both times of the nuts)
the line was decent, the wait was within reason considering it's NY train station. I thought the ingredients were fresh and appreciated the varied salad dressings.
I would come back, I am surprised at the reviews for this place, could probably agree with the protein scarcity

originalText.text: I came back to the Chopt after a year to try the Chinese Chicken this time. I ordered the warm Chicken bowl, but I was disappointed to find that it only had 4-5 really tiny pieces of chicken meat. While the food was tasty and well-seasoned as a salad, I don't think it's appropriate to call it a Chicken bowl with such a small amount of chicken. It's a shame!

text.text: I came back to the Chopt after a year to try the Chinese Chicken this time. I ordered the warm Chicken bowl, but I was disappointed to find that it only had 4-5 really tiny pieces of chicken meat. While the food was tasty and well-seasoned as a salad, I don't think it's appropriate to call it a Chicken bowl with such a small amount of chicken. It's a shame!

originalText.text:
For full disclosure, I am typically a Just Salad guy but in an all out frenzy to make my train to Philly, I thought Chopt would be the ideal quick option that still allows me to stay on the path to a Rockstar skinny frame.

Other than the guy giving me some attitude when taking my order, I now hold Chopt in the highest regard of fast casual healthy food. The attitude came when I asked for no cheese on my salad and got no confirmation, so I did my best to double check without sounding like a mf Karen, and he said "I HEARD you." Like damn bro lmao. But I mean it could have been a bad day and working at the train station Chopt can't be the easiest job.

To my surprise they had me in and out of that line in under 5 minutes. After the sweet cashier handed me my Blissful Harvest bowl, I was oddly reminiscent of a prime Devin Hester having just fielded a punt at the 20 yard line and turned on the JETS through Moynihan Hall to track 6. I ended up making the train with like 8 minutes to spare so I really didn't need to do allat, but no pressure no diamond you feel me?

I sat down in the last car of the Amtrak train, and cracked open my Blissful Harvest bowl made up of kale, chicken, sweet potatoes, rice, and apples dressed with a white balsamic vinegar dressing and dug in. It was honestly fantastic, tasting about as fresh as you can get for one of these fast casual salad chains. I was shocked how good it was.

As the car began to move, the hero reared his head to look out the window in anticipation for the weekend ahead... Him and his Blissful Harvest Bowl vs the world...

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__

originalText.text: Such a disappointment. I remember when chopt was my top choice. What a disappointment. I should've read the reviews. The quality of the salad has gone down especially for the cost. The person taking the order wasn't attentive, the person chopping my salad failed at chopping and the register person just rushed me. I guess Sweet Green will continue to be my top choice after this.

I guess Sweet Green will continue to be my top choice after this.
